definition: to keep watch beside a coffin
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: After Forestier's death, he and Mrs. Forestier kept a vigil over the corpse.
sentences.chinese: 弗賴斯節死後，杜洛瓦同弗賴斯節夫人一起守靈。

sentences.english: It was held at Albans School in Northwest Washington.
sentences.chinese: 守靈被安排在華盛頓西北部的奧爾本斯學校。

sentences.english: Players will hold funerals and wakes for characters who die.
sentences.chinese: 玩家們會爲死去的角色送葬守靈。

sentences.english: They don't try to understand Kafka or Finnegans Wake.
sentences.chinese: 他們並不試圖理解卡夫卡或者《芬內根守靈》。

sentences.english: Finnegans Wake is a book of"chaosmos".
sentences.chinese: 《芬尼根守靈夜》乃一本“混沌之書”。

sentences.english: You know why certain religions have wakes?
sentences.chinese: 知道某些宗教爲什麼要守靈嗎？

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zhong1 xin1

definition: after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
to be reluctant to give up a post
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
on one's deathbed/at the point of death
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
